definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: Raise your hand if you take your bedtime routine seriously.
sentences.chinese: 如果你認真對待作息時間，那就舉高雙手。

sentences.english: No one arranges your time or dictates your schedule.
sentences.chinese: 沒人強制安排你的作息時間表。

sentences.english: Go to bed and get up at the same time daily.
sentences.chinese: 保持每天穩定的作息時間。

sentences.english: A regular bedtime and rising time can help you stablize your internal clocks.
sentences.chinese: 定一個規律的作息時間，持之以恆。

sentences.english: Doctors warned the public that cold warm, and adjust a good schedule.
sentences.chinese: 醫生提醒市民注意防寒保暖，並調整好作息時間。

sentences.english: I just sleep on a different schedule, one that’s self-maintaining and actually very easy.
sentences.chinese: 我只需要保持在一個新的作息時間睡覺，這很容易。

sentences.english: Neurasthenia patients should be arranged according to the calendar life and study.
sentences.chinese: 神經衰弱患者應按照作息時間安排生活和學習。

sentences.english: Don’t change your bedtime and rising time on weekends.
sentences.chinese: 不要在週末改變你的作息時間。

sentences.english: Many Chinese have adjusted their daily timetable and some office workers have quit taking naps so they might watch videos at noon.
sentences.chinese: 不少中國人調整了自己的作息時間。

definition: to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
to attend school as a day student
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
to repeat a lesson/to learn by heart/to endorse a check
